content: supplies scrap small amounts of yarn about 20g yarn total weights can be mixed scrunchie 2 sets of 16 long circular needles any sizes from 4-8 or match the size to your yarn 4-5 set up using a provisional crochet cast-on and cotton for fingering/sport scrap yarn co 90 sts onto one 16 circular needle make a couple of extra chains at the end for ease in finding the 6-8 for chain to pull out fasten_off chain and cut your co yarn dk/worsted place a marker on your needle to make the beginning of crochet hook your rounds 1-2 yards cotton scrap yarn for round 1 and all following rounds k all sts cast-on elastic hair band work in stockinette just knit stitch until your work stitch marker measures about 3 5 from cast-on you can change yarns or yarn needle for colors as necessary weaving in ends finishing your scrunchie when you have knit to the desired width leave your needle in your sts and pull out gauge your provisional cast-on placing the sts on your second 16 not important circular needle turn your tube inside-out purl sts facing out and slip a hair band around the waist of your tube if abbreviations you changed yarns as you knit this is the time to weave in any tails although they will be enclosed in the inside of co cast on your work fold your knit tube up and over the hair band st s stitch es in half so that the circular needles meet and the hair band k knit is hidden inside now the right side of your work is facing k2tog knit 2 stitches you again together decrease made using a three needle bind-off* and one stitch from each bobble bind off circular needle this is like a k2tog with one stitch from the front needle and one stitch from the back needle *k2tog bind off around your scrunchie back to the marker fasten off cut yarn and weave in ends *for three-needle bind-off you can use the right hand 285 e 5th ave needle from the circulars closest to you a third spare eugene or 97401 needle or your crochet hook
